extendedInfo.description: This is the free version of the exynos automated medication reminder. The app shows different colors for each status and different notification bar icons for due, overdue, and low medication count.*** Disclaimer This app is for information purposes only and are not a substitute for professional medical or health advice, examination, diagnosis, or treatment. Information provided here is not intended as specific medical advice. In the event of an emergency, please call 911.Always seek the advice of your physician or other qualified health professional. Do not delay seeking or disregard medical advice based on information on this app. Medical information changes rapidly and some information may be out of date. The information should not be used to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease without the supervision of a medical doctor. Thank you.

reviews.title: manually track your meds
reviews.comment: App worked fine on my phone however it did not do what I need, I needed a med program with alarms that would go off like a timer that refreshes itself
reviews.author: Sarah Sage

reviews.comment: Easy to use. Now that I have several medication s to take every day, this helps to make sure I take them at the right times.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Pretty good
reviews.comment: Needs customizeable frequency (e.g. every other day, twice per week) and could use a function for tapering. Also doesn\'t use dosage at all.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Great app for my husband\'s medications.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Keep me updated with my nanny\'s meds
reviews.author: Lucky Money

reviews.title: Needs more
reviews.comment: This app is ok. However, it needs more to choose from, such as the route. You can\'t choose an injection, or rub ons. If that were available it would be better.
reviews.author: A Google User
